meanings.definition: In a way that is not capable of being done or put into practice.
meanings.sent1: The task was impracticably difficult for the young child to complete.
meanings.sent2: She knew that climbing Mount Everest was impracticably challenging for her skill level.
meanings.sent3: Trying to eat a whole watermelon in one bite would be impracticably messy!
meanings.sent4: His dream of flying without wings was impracticably ambitious.
meanings.sent5: The idea of building a house in a day seemed impracticably impossible.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is not feasible or realistic.
meanings.sent1: The plan to travel to Mars impracticably ignored the need for oxygen.
meanings.sent2: She knew that becoming a mermaid was impracticably unrealistic.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fit an elephant in a suitcase would be impracticably silly!
meanings.sent4: His hope of finding a pot of gold at the end of a rainbow was impracticably fanciful.
meanings.sent5: The thought of growing wings and flying away was impracticably far-fetched.
